text: The Notre Dame Fighting Irish women's lacrosse team is an NCAA Division I college lacrosse team representing the University of Notre Dame as part of the Atlantic Coast Conference. They play their home games at Arlotta Family Lacrosse Stadium in Notre Dame, Indiana. ==Individual career records== Reference: {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:140px; "|Record ! style="width:35px; "|Amount ! style="width:140px; "|Player ! style="width:70px; "|Years |- style="text-align:center;" | Goals || 262 || Jillian Byers || 2006-09 |- style="text-align:center;" | Assists || 151 || Maggie Tamasitis || 2009-12 |- style="text-align:center;" | Points || 336 || Jillian Byers || 2006-09 |- style="text-align:center;" | Ground balls || 193 || Kathryn Lam || 1999-02 |- style="text-align:center;" | Draw controls || 269 || Barbara Sullivan || 2012-16 |- style="text-align:center;" | Caused turnovers || 159 || Barbara Sullivan || 2012-16 |- style="text-align:center;" | Saves || 528 || Ellie Hilling || 2010-13 |- style="text-align:center;" | Save % || .531 || Tara Durkin || 2000-01 |- style="text-align:center;" | GAA || 8.79 || Jen White || 2000-03 |} ==Individual single-season records== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:140px; "|Record ! style="width:35px; "|Amount ! style="width:140px; "|Player ! style="width:50px; "|Years |- style="text-align:center;" | Goals || 83 || Jillian Byers || 2009 |- style="text-align:center;" | Assists || 59 || Maggie Tamasitis || 2012 |- style="text-align:center;" | Points || 114 || Crysti Foote || 2006 |- style="text-align:center;" | Ground balls || 64 || Margaret Smith || 2014 |- style="text-align:center;" | Draw controls || 98 || Andie Aldave || 2018 |- style="text-align:center;" | Caused turnovers || 55 || Barbara Sullivan || 2016 |- style="text-align:center;" | Saves || 180 || Samantha Giacolone || 2017 |- style="text-align:center;" | Save % || .548 || Tara Durkin || 2000 |- style="text-align:center;" | GAA || 7.49 || Jen White || 2002 |} ==Seasons== Reference: ==Postseason Results== The Fighting Irish have appeared in 12 NCAA tournaments.
